article.description: Mount St. Mary's, Md. 85, Cent. Connecticut St. 58
article.headline: Mount St. Mary's, Md. 85, Cent. Connecticut St. 58
article.linkText: Mount St. Mary's, Md. 85, Cent. Connecticut St. 58
article.story: EMMITSBURG, Md. -- Jeremy Goode scored 26 points and Mount St. Mary's (Md.) shot 64.3 percent from the 3-point line to defeat Central Connecticut State 85-58 on Thursday night. Goode hit two of his three 3-point attempts to help the Mountaineers (12-14, 9-6 Northeast Conference) go 9-for-14 from beyond the arc and extend their winning streak to seven games. Mount St. Mary's led 40-35 at halftime, but outscored Central Connecticut State 45-23 in the second half as the Blue Devils (9-17, 6-8) shot 36 percent from the field (9-for-25). Central Connecticut State scored the first basket of the second half, but the Mountaineers went on an 11-0 run for a 51-37 lead with 15:46 left. They extended the lead to 65-40 on Goode's jumper with 8:39 to play. Kelly Beidler and Shawn Atupem scored 14 points each for the Mountaineers. Shemik Thompson scored 22 and Joe Efese had 15 for the Blue Devils.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
